summary: Two new features implemented in web4-trust-core since last review: Creative Reasoning Detection module and Presence Tracking with silence-as-signal governance. Both represent significant governance enhancements that require whitepaper documentation. Hardware binding status should also be updated to reflect TPM 2.0 working implementation.

proposals.scope: Expand governance section with new presence tracking capability
proposals.description: Add subsection documenting 'Silence as Signal' governance model. New PresenceTracker infrastructure (presence.py, 278 lines) enables absence detection and T3 integration via apply_silence_penalty(). This addresses governance resilience gap: systems that only react to explicit failures miss half the intelligence. Should be presented as an extension to governance-through-resonance concept—absence of expected activity is trust-relevant information.

Integration: hooks/heartbeat.py emits presence signals on session tool calls

proposals.description: Add subsection on distinguishing creative reasoning from fabrication in AI governance. Implements creative_reasoning_eval.py (581 lines) addressing critical gap from Thor Session #31. Classifies four reasoning types: FABRICATION, CREATIVE_REASONING, UNCERTAIN_EXPLORATION, FACTUAL_SYNTHESIS. Uses 23 hedging markers (uncertainty acknowledgment) and 20 fabrication markers (false claims, S43/S44 patterns). Integrates with identity_integrity.py and R6 evaluation pipeline. This represents enhancement to T3 temperament scoring and coherence evaluation.
implementation_evidence: Integration point: SAGE R6 evaluation pipeline
Validated by: Thor Session #31 (Exploration Reframe Validation)
Based on: Sessions #28-31 multi-dimensional coherence framework
proposals.terminology_impact: New terms: creative_reasoning_eval, fabrication_markers, hedging_markers, reasoning classification scheme (4 types), S43/S44 pattern detection

notes: Both new features (presence tracking and creative reasoning detection) are governance enhancements, not foundational architecture changes. They integrate cleanly into existing T3/V3 framework.
Creative reasoning detection addresses long-standing SAGE/Thor research gap (Sessions #28-31), making it semantically important for whitepaper credibility.
Presence tracking represents philosophical shift: 'absence is signal' extends resonance-based governance to negative space.
Hardware binding update is clarification only—no architectural change, just accuracy correction.
All new terminology is domain-specific and non-conflicting with canonical terms from PUBLISHER_CONTEXT.md.
Review note: PUBLISHER_CONTEXT was last updated 2026-01-23; new commits are 2026-01-25 (one day old), so inclusion criteria are clearly met (code implements new features).
Commit pattern shows active development in web4-trust-core and hardbound-core with experimental validation (Thor/SAGE sessions referenced).
rationale: Both new implementations are production-ready code with test coverage and clear integration paths. They represent governance capability enhancements (not experimental). The presence tracking and creative reasoning modules should be documented before they are deployed more widely.
